content: round 31-32 knit round 33 purl round 34 knit round 35 ssk ssk k6 k2tog k2tog repeat 20 sts round 36 knit cast off tidy up hole while weaving in end hole remains open finishing weave in ends make sure all ends are weaved in or hidden inside your mushroom if desired use your cast on end to stitch the small hole closed at the top or leave it open and insert some chimney smoke embroidery the door is made using satin stitch see pg 2 for photos for doors location first locate center st on the bottom white round about 6 sts from each side the center st is the middle of the door the door is 3 sts wide and 5 sts high i place a horizontal stitch on the top and bottom hide ends inside try not to stitch the 2 sides together the door knob is made with a french knot i use sock yarn my window is located 3 sts up from the top of the door and made with long sts that are about 3 sts high and 3 sts wide i used sock yarn so that a cross could fit inside hide all ends stuffing to stuff your mushroom push some stuffing up into the top of your mushroom through the bottom hole i like to push it in with my thumb don t stuff the cap too much or it will be top heavy i like to make my stem firm with lots of stuffing thanks/pattern support thanks for choosing one of my designs for pattern help just pm me 5
